p: Chikungunya virus (CHIKV) is a mosquito-transmitted arbovirus belonging to the alphavirus genus of the Togaviridae family [ 1]. The major vectors of CHIKV are Aedes aegypti and Aedes albopictus. Importantly, CHIKV is the etiologic agent of chikungunya fever (CHIKF), a rheumatic-like disease typically characterized by high fever, prolonged polyarthralgia, myalgia, rash and sometimes death [ 2â€“ 4]. However, to date no effective vaccine or specific therapeutic is available to prevent or treat CHIKV infection [ 5].
